an10.74:4.1: “Mendicants, a noble disciple who grows in ten ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
an10.74:4.3: He grows in fields and lands, money and grain, wives and children, in slaves, workers, and servants, and in livestock. And he grows in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
an10.74:4.4: A noble disciple who grows in five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.”
an10.74:5.1: “Someone who grows in money and grain,
an10.74:5.4: by relatives and friends, and even by royals.
an10.74:6.1: When someone grows in faith and ethics,
an10.74:6.2: wisdom, and both generosity and learning—
an10.74:6.3: a good man such as he sees clearly,
an10.74:6.4: and in the present life he grows in both ways.”
